node.title: Refugee sponsorship scheme sees Kiwis volunteer to help settle migrants
node.description: New Zealanders are putting their hands up to take on the job of settling refugees, through a new programme that is on top of the annual quota.

node.title: Lawyers challenge Climate Change Commission's advice on emissions reduction
node.description: A group of lawyers will today argue in the High Court that the Climate Change Commission's roadmap for cutting emissions does not go hard enough or fast enough.

node.title: Lawyers take case against Climate Commission demanding faster action
node.description: A group of lawyers will today argue in the High Court that the Climate Change Commission's roadmap for cutting emissions does not go hard enough or fast enough.

node.title: Fence around U.S. Capitol going back up ahead of State of the Union
node.description: The decision to reinstall the fence around the Capitol was made "out of an abundance of caution," Capitol Police Chief Tom Manger said in a statement.

node.title: Sanctions a response to Russia's 'act of war' - Acting Foreign Minister
node.description: David Parker says New Zealand stands ready to do its bit to counter Russia's "unprovoked and illegal" attack on Ukraine. Audio

node.title: Two years on, New Zealand seeing highest Covid-19 numbers yet
node.description: Tomorrow marks the second anniversary of Aotearoa's first Covid-19 case. But rapid tests and spread among young people are making it a very different pandemic.

node.title: Transcript: World Bank President David Malpass on "Face the Nation"
node.description: The following is a transcript of an interview with World Bank President David Malpass that aired Sunday, February 27, 2022, on "Face the Nation."

node.title: NZ announces bans on Russia in response to Ukraine invasion
node.description: In response to Russia's invasion of Ukraine, New Zealand's government is implementing a range of measures, including a travel ban on Russian officials and limiting diplomatic engagements.

node.title: Liz Cheney says Russia sanctions "ought to go further"
node.description: "We certainly haven't reached the limit" on sanctions against Russia, Cheney said.

node.title: EU shuts airspace to Russian planes, bans pro-Kremlin media outlets
node.description: The 27-nation bloc will close its airspace to Russian airlines, fund supplies of weapons to Ukraine and ban some pro-Kremlin media outlets.

node.title: Protest at Parliament grounds: 'This is not a safe place' - police
node.description: Police say leaders of the anti-mandate protests at Parliament grounds have lost control of unruly members within the crowd, with one man arrested last night and charged with inciting violence.

node.title: Hunt for beneficiaries ongoing two year after man's death
node.description: Popular Napier and Auckland man Ian David Smith died almost two years ago. He named 143 people in his will - its executor told RNZ about the ongoing hunt for them. Audio

node.title: Transcript: H.R. McMaster on "Face the Nation"
node.description: The following is a transcript of an interview with former national security adviser and retired Lieutenant General H.R. McMaster that aired Sunday, February 27, 2022, on "Face the Nation."

node.title: Transcript: Representative Liz Cheney on "Face the Nation"
node.description: The following is a transcript of an interview with GOP Representative Liz Cheney of Wyoming that aired Sunday, February 27, 2022, on "Face the Nation."

node.title: Covid-19 update: 14,941 new cases reported in NZ today
node.description: There has been a record 14,941 new community cases of Covid-19 reported in New Zealand today, with 305 people now in hospital.

node.title: Auckland Domain closed to vehicles due to camping protesters
node.description: The Auckland Domain remains closed to vehicles until further notice, because a small number of anti-mandate protesters have set up tents there and stayed overnight.

node.title: Teenager dies from box jellyfish sting
node.description: A North Queensland beach community is in shock after a teenage boy died from a box jellyfish sting on Saturday afternoon.

node.title: Transcript: Representative James Clyburn on "Face the Nation"
node.description: The following is a transcript of an interview with Democratic Representative James Clyburn of South Carolina that aired Sunday, February 27, 2022, on "Face the Nation."

node.title: Clyburn urges "strong bipartisan support" for Ketanji Brown Jackson
node.description: "This is beyond politics. This is about the country, our pursuit of a more perfect union," Clyburn said.

node.title: New Zealand trails by 207
node.description: All-rounder Colin de Grandhomme struck a belligerent half-century to steady New Zealand in the second test after South Africa's seamers torched the home side's top order during a see-sawing day two in…

node.title: Russia's invasion of Ukraine is a test for America: John Dickerson
node.description: The CBS News correspondent says standing up to Putin's lawless violation of another country's sovereignty – an attack on the values of self-determination and freedom – is a test of American ideals and morals.

node.title: Artist Shirley Woodson: Life captured in bold strokes
node.description: There's a lot going on in the vivid paintings of the 85-year-old artist and former schoolteacher, whose work is being celebrated with her first one-woman show at the Detroit Institute of Arts.

node.title: Ryan Reynolds and Shawn Levy on time travel and "The Adam Project"
node.description: The star of "Deadpool" and the director of "Free Guy" have teamed up again on a new time-travel film, about a fighter pilot from the future who meets his 12-year-old self, and gets a chance at a do-over.

node.title: King cakes, a treasured taste of Mardi Gras
node.description: In New Orleans a longstanding tradition of Carnival is the king cake, a multi-colored sweet treat. And while there are many different varieties, there is only one way to enjoy them.

node.title: U.S. ambassador to U.N.: Putin's nuclear order "totally unacceptable"
node.description: "It just means that we have to ramp up our efforts here at the United Nations and elsewhere to hold him accountable," she said.

node.title: The life of a CIA shadow warrior
node.description: In his memoir "Black Ops," Ric Prado writes of his 24 years with U.S. intelligence, including working undercover with anti-communist rebels in Central America, and tracking a rising financier of terrorism named Osama bin Laden.

node.title: Savannah restaurant serves up common ground on race
node.description: Built in what was once a segregated bus terminal, The Grey is a destination restaurant that defies preconceived notions about Southern cooking. Its partners' conversations about race have become a book: "Black, White, and The Grey."

node.title: The long history of Russia's efforts to subjugate Ukraine
node.description: Three decades after gaining its independence from the Soviet Union, Ukraine is again fighting for its freedom. Historian Anne Applebaum discusses the historic oppression of the Ukrainian people by Czarist and Stalinist forces, and now by the war machines of Vladimir Putin.

node.title: Transcript: U.N. Ambassador Linda Thomas-Greenfield on "Face the Nation"
node.description: The following is a transcript of an interview with U.N. Ambassador Linda Thomas-Greenfield that aired Sunday, February 27, 2022, on "Face the Nation."

node.title: Russian troops meet resistance in Ukraine's second-largest city
node.description: Street fighting broke out in Ukraine's second-largest city and Russian troops squeezed strategic ports in the country's south Sunday.
